title: SPARE
author: SPARE
content: Bitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.Source

comments.author: Cvetik56
comments.body: That definitely seems good. But we'll see if he'll stay true to his words. If he's honest, it's a great new beginning for the country and the whole crypto industry.

comments.author: abramovf
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceThis has already started to show its effect. Some sites are reporting that bitcoin gained 3% because of this news like this articlehttps://www.coindesk.com/markets/2023/11/20/javier-milei-wins-argentine-presidency-bitcoin-gains-nearly-3/I am sure that long term impact will be even better with the new government making regulations in favor of Crypto for Argentina people. Argentina population is about 0.57% of the total world population so this can translate to a number of news users in crypto world.

comments.author: rachael9385
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceAccording to my Nigerian time zone, I was alated with the notification of the Argentina new president, however, I confirmed that the new president is also a Bitcoin lover.https://apnews.com/article/argentina-election-president-milei-massa-a4811c5229d35551f8dbf7056d87aae6The link above will tell how the citizens of the Argentina country loves their new president, although I can't really tell if they like their president based on he is a Bitcoin lover.Gradually gradually, Bitcoin is moving at a good speed and also spreading.

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceWe need to wait and see, remember the politicians are good in promises but not in doing it better, while He is a Bitcoin lover then are we expecting something like what had happened in EL Salvador?because this is what mostly to happen if He is true to his word and seeing Bitcoin will help their country to recover from falling.But happy to hear another president will have good act for our precious bitcoin.

comments.author: Agbamoni
comments.body: OP I think this topic will best fit in Politics and Society so you can try moving the topic there.However, it's a good thing that most countries government officials are willing to embrace cryptocurrency. Perhaps they have seen and believe in the new technology. Very soon we will be hearing news about Bitcoin campaign and rallies in Argentina and many of the citizens will begin to accept Bitcoin and at last may be accepted as a means of exchange in their country.

comments.author: fuguebtc
comments.body: Quote from: kotajikikox on November 20, 2023, 07:55:13 AMQuote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceWe need to wait and see, remember the politicians are good in promises but not in doing it better, while He is a Bitcoin lover then are we expecting something like what had happened in EL Salvador?because this is what mostly to happen if He is true to his word and seeing Bitcoin will help their country to recover from falling.But happy to hear another president will have good act for our precious bitcoin.This possibility cannot be ruled out, because during election times , to win people's trust, they are willing to do anything to achieve their goals . Many politicians make great statements during the election campaign, but when they become president, they fail to deliver on their promises. Anyway , this is welcome news for bitcoin investors in Argentina. And I hope he will not only be more open to bitcoin but also be able to help Argentina escape their country's current crisis. As far as I know , the inflation situation in them is getting as bad as in Turkiye.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceIt will be interesting to other prominent people in the society to embrace bitcoin in the society, and secondly what I will want the new elected president to do concerning cryptocurrency is to ensure that it has make a bitcoin a legal tender since is a lover of bitcoin despite that the legalisation of bitcoin has to be pass it into law, because if it happens to me I will ensure that I have legalised bitcoin, so bitcoin will have more dominance again across the world.

comments.author: mirakal
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.Source Argentina has one of the highest crypto adoption rates so it’s not surprising that majority of the citizens here are bitcoin lovers and holders as well. Well, with regards to this newly elected president that is bitcoin lover, this is good news for the crypto community as it’s going to create a positive boost most especially if this president will be able to create promotions about bitcoin so that their country will be next in line with El Salvador that is totally on bitcoin. For now, we are in awe of what could be this president has to offer that is connected to bitcoin, so let’s just wait and see for the next months and years if he’s really devoted into bitcoin, or just like other presidents who’s promises have been broken.

comments.author: EluguHcman
comments.body: Congratulations to his victory but the politicians are definitely not a solid wall to lean on as there sugarcoated words are dearly to attract personal interests favour from the masses at the time of electoral campaigns.And if only these Political alleys could have exhibit are promised during its campaigns, the then they could be reliable.However, with benefit of doubts, there is set to be a massive excelling as this course that is to tender global enhancements with an authorized massive adoptions and a wide spread of Bitcoin through his regimes in government.

comments.author: lombok
comments.body: Quote from: rachael9385 on November 20, 2023, 07:27:08 AMQuote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceAccording to my Nigerian time zone, I was alated with the notification of the Argentina new president, however, I confirmed that the new president is also a Bitcoin lover.https://apnews.com/article/argentina-election-president-milei-massa-a4811c5229d35551f8dbf7056d87aae6The link above will tell how the citizens of the Argentina country loves their new president, although I can't really tell if they like their president based on he is a Bitcoin lover.Gradually gradually, Bitcoin is moving at a good speed and also spreading. Bitcoin will continue to grow with innovation from lovers. We know that the President has an important and vital role in every policy taken by the country's government. Therefore, this is an opportunity for Bitcoin to fill the void that exists in the country. Will Argentina follow in El Salvador's footsteps? Hopefully the first thing Argentina will do first is improve its economic situation because it experienced major inflation this year before seriously responding to Bitcoin.

comments.author: Popkon6
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceWe will have to wait and see how much importance Argentina's president-elect places on Bitcoin. But I think the legal tender clause would only be appropriate if it declares bitcoin legal, as Argentina has a large number of bitcoin/crypto holders.  As has been done by El Salvador's President, Nayib Bukele, he has accepted Bitcoin and declared Bitcoin legal following all principles of legal tender. And he has bought many bitcoins which will protect him from future financial storms. Because Bitcoin is the most suitable way to invest for a long time, because Bitcoin will definitely have high speed with its own speed. El Salvador's Volcano Energy is generating energy.

comments.author: krishnaverma
comments.body: We should not get excited by this news. Though the new president is Bitcoin lover, making regulations related to crypto will have lot of hurdles for him. Let us see if he can cross them.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceWhen I watched to their presidential election debate, I noticed he has a lot of similarities with former president of the US. He was vocal about his plans and visions and seems determine to do just like he said. He challenged the financial systems and promised to embark on several reforms that will change the status quo including the central banking system. But I see a little problem in all of them. Will he have the political will to challenge the powers that be? Argentina is not that of a strong country and they have a lot of unsettle businesses with IMF, can Javier Milei withstand the pressure from these powerful organisations? As for the future of Bitcoin in Argentina, the new administration will most likely legalise Bitcoin just like El Salvador did but I don't think they will see the benefits immediately because they have a lot to address ranging from unemployment, inflation and poverty.

comments.author: coinremitter
comments.body: Fantastic news for the cryptocurrency community in Argentina! Javier Milei's victory in the presidential run-off election on Nov. 19 is a significant milestone. With over 55% of the votes and a substantial lead of nearly 3 million votes, it's clear that his Bitcoin-friendly stance resonated with a large portion of the population. This victory could potentially pave the way for more favorable regulatory environments and increased acceptance of cryptocurrencies in Argentina. It's a positive sign for crypto enthusiasts and investors alike, highlighting the growing influence of digital currencies in shaping political landscapes. As always, it's crucial for the community to stay informed and engaged as developments unfold. Cheers to a promising future for cryptocurrency adoption in Argentina!

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: President being crypto-friendly doesn't mean it will be positive news for the whole crypto market.Let's note that there are still other authorities that are against crypto and might stop making some regulations.I did a quick search and based on this website, the total percent of the population that is currently holding Bitcoin this 2023 is only 5%. Well, it's in the top 15 for the highest number of population who own Bitcoin. With the new president that's pro-crypto, I expect it to go even higher. I don't know if this will have an effect on the price of Bitcoin, but let's just not overreact with this one as we don't know what the newly-elected president will do. There might be a chance that he just used cryptocurrency to increase his popularity. I mean they're politicians, and I'm not generalizing all of them, but there's a "CHANCE".

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceThe celebration in the air is quite massive that many media outlets are reporting that Javier Milei's presidential election victory is responsible for the current surge of Bitcoin. For someone who's pro Bitcoin and very critical of the central bank that he even labelled it a scam, many bitcoinists will be hoping that his administration can help promote the widespread of Bitcoin in Argentina and across latin America... I guess we'll have to wait and see, but at the moment the victory is worth celebrating.

comments.author: Magic-Money
comments.body: That is very good News and I believe is going to win the election in Argentina as a president, which is going to create a good impact or add more advantage in the cryptocurrency space adoption.

comments.author: kingvirtus09
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceSorry to ask if this presidential winner is a Bitcoin or crypto lover. If yes, it means that he has been given many promises platforms about bitcoin and crypto. Once he wins, right?We know that when there are many promises, usually the words are not fulfilled simply or immediately because it is not that easy to implement them in reality. or the others, after winning or sitting in the position, immediately forget most of the promises. I hope he fulfills whatever he promised, and may it happen if there really is.

comments.author: AYOBA
comments.body: Quote from: SPARE on November 20, 2023, 05:42:49 AMBitcoin-friendly  Javier Milei won the country’s presidential run-off election on Nov. 19, beating out his opponent Sergio Massa. With almost 99% of the vote counted, Milei won over 55% of the votes with a nearly 3 million vote lead according to Bloomberg data.SourceIf what is being said is accurate, this is fantastic news because politicians in general cannot be trusted, that is how they will make promises when proposing. And, after winning or obtaining the desired position, they will promptly forget all past pledges. If he keeps his word, I believe it will make all their country happy and also proud him. And once more, it would be amazing if he acknowledges Bitcoin as legitimate money, which would lead to an increase in the number of Bitcoin users.
